titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Arthur Machen Collection
titlestmt.author: by Beinecke Staff

publicationstmt.publisher: Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Saturday December 8, 2018 at 06:30
profiledesc.descrules: translation missing: en.enumerations.resource_finding_aid_description_rules.beinecke manuscript unit archival processing manual

did.unittitle: Arthur Machen collection

repository.corpname: Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library

did.abstract: Contains correspondence to, from, and about Machen. Correspondents include Aldrich Munson Havens, Charles Parsons, and Vincent Starrett, among others. Also contains holograph, typescript, and proof versions of Machen's writings, such as "The Garden of Avallaunius", "The Memoirs of Jacques Casanova", and "The Secret Glory."

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Ongoing collection of documents acquired by gift and purchase from various sources. Type of accession (gift or purchase) and date of acquisition is noted in the box-and-folder list. For further information, consult the appropriate curator.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: The Arthur Machen Collection is the physical property of the Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library, Yale University. Literary rights, including copyright, belong to the authors or their legal heirs and assigns. For further information, consult the appropriate curator.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Arthur Machen Collection. General Collection, Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library, Yale University.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The materials are open for research. Restricted Fragile Papers in Box 11 may only be consulted with permission of the appropriate curator. Preservation photocopies for reference use have been substituted in the main files.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: This finding aid was produced from previously existing cards in the Manuscript Catalog, or from another inventory. All pertinent bibliographical information has been retained. If the collection also contains unlisted or unsorted material, it has been noted in the box-and-folder list. This finding aid will be updated periodically to account for new materials that may be added to the collection. The date of the most recent update is noted on the title page. For information on material that may have been added since the last update, please consult the Public Service Desk. Because an extensive amount of material was added at once, as of July 1999, the collection was renumbered.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This finding aid encompasses accessions of single manuscripts and small groups of manuscripts and other papers, by or pertaining to Arthur Machen, which the library has chosen to group and list as an artificial collection.

did.unittitle: Materials Given by Charles Parsons
CORRESPONDENCE
Letters from Arthur Machen
6 ALS to Munson Havens, London
12 ALS to Charles Parsons, London

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes 12 envelopes; laid in are two telegrams with addressed envelope (London, 1925 Oct 5).

did.unittitle: WRITINGS OF ARTHUR MACHEN
"Ballad of the Armed Man," [London?]

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Original autograph manuscript with title, "An excellent ballad of the Armed Man, very pleasent & profitable for the present times by Arthur Machen, gent."; laid in is a manuscript note, signed, explaining the composing of the "Armed Man" (1924 Sep).

did.unittitle: Biographical and critical manuscript notes

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Published as pages 14, 28, and 49-55 of Arthur Machen: A Bibliography by Henry Danielson (London, 1923).

did.unittitle: "The Confessions of a Literary Man"

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Newspaper clipping from the Evening News (London, 1915 Mar-Jun), signed and corrected in the author's hand as he prepared the text for publishing in book form by Martin Secker under the title, "Far Off Things."

Starrett, post-marked London, 1922 May 15, presumably from John Rodker, enclosing the galley proof of the "Preface."

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Restricted Fragile Papers in Box 11 may only be consulted with permission of the appropriate curator. Preservation photocopies for reference use have been substituted in the main files.
